description: Exports API collection from YOUR forked Postman workspace and parses into clean JSON with all endpoints, methods, and parameters.
Generates Python tool specification from extracted API data with RTFF protocol compliance and OrchestrateOS integration.
Lists all APIs registered in the collection mappings with their collection UIDs and total count.
Auto-discovers all collections in Postman workspace and adds new ones to postman_collections.json mappings. Skips existing entries to preserve manual overrides.
Adds a new command (API call definition) under a given key in an existing actions file.
Creates a new blank API actions file (e.g., Airtable, ConvertKit) in the api_actions/ directory.
Creates a blank tool-specific API file for structured usage (e.g. convertkit.txt).
Deletes a command (key) from the specified API actions file.
Runs the specified command using subprocess, injecting any provided variables or API keys.
Retrieves the actual API command string stored under a specific key.
Lists all defined command keys in the specified API actions file.
Renames a key within an existing actions file — useful for reorganizing command names.
Updates an existing API command in the specified actions file.
Registers new event type with test expression for evaluating entry state changes (e.g., 'new_entry != old_entry').
Adds automation rule with trigger and action definition. Supports single actions or multi-step workflows with simplified flat parameter passing.
Deletes a rule by index from the automation rule set.
Manually fires an event trigger and runs all matching rules with provided context.
Returns all registered event types and their trigger expressions.
Returns the full list of defined automation rules.
Modifies existing event type key and test expression.
Updates existing rule by index with new trigger, condition, and action. Uses simplified context resolution without nested parameter construction.
Internal background job function for course deployment. Do not call directly - invoked by publish_course.
Specialized function to add lectures, labs, and quizzes to a module. Pass arrays of file names.
Specialized function to add modules to a course structure.
Unified create function for all Canvas entity types (module, lecture, lab, quiz, course). Pass entity_type and entity_name plus any entity-specific parameters.
Unified edit function for all Canvas entity types. Pass updates dict with fields to modify. For quizzes, supports add_questions, remove_question_index, update_question operations.
Unified publish function for all Canvas entity types. Publishes the entity to Canvas with the specified course_id.
Specialized function for publishing entire course with all modules. Runs as background job. Returns job_id for tracking progress.
Unified view function for all Canvas entity types. Returns the draft data for the specified entity.
Bulletproof task queue system. Claude removed from task_id generation. Parser output goes directly to batch_assign.

params.description: Create a spec document for the new feature

description: GPT assigns a task to Claude Code queue. Required: description. Optional: priority, context, create_output_doc, batch_id, auto_execute. Auto-generates deterministic task_id from description hash (prevents duplicates).
Assign demo task with guaranteed 'demo_' prefix. Auto-prepends prefix if missing. Otherwise identical to assign_task.
Assign multiple tasks at once with aggressive deduplication. Used internally by self_assign_from_doc. Checks: exact task_id match in queue, exact task_id in recent results, fuzzy content match.
Check status of a task. Required: task_id. Returns: queued, in_progress, done, error, cancelled.
Internal: Claude calls this to get queued tasks. Returns list of pending tasks. GPT should NOT call this.
Internal: Claude calls this when starting a task. Marks status as in_progress. GPT should NOT call this.
Internal: Claude calls this when completing a task. Required: task_id, status. Optional: actions_taken, output, output_summary, errors, execution_time_seconds. GPT should NOT call this.
Spawns Claude Code session to process all queued tasks. Returns immediately. GPT calls this after assigning tasks to trigger autonomous execution.
Checks the status of all pending deck generations in the queue. Downloads completed decks to exports/.
Polls Gamma's API for the current generation status of a specific deck using its ID.
Submits a text file to Gamma's API to generate a presentation deck. num_cards specifies number of slides (defaults to 10 if not provided). Saves the request to a local queue.
Scans the data directory for all .txt files and submits them to Gamma as a batch deck generation request. num_cards applies to all decks in batch (defaults to 10).
Lists all .txt files in the data directory with their size and last modified timestamp.
Polls Gamma API for generation completion and downloads PDF when ready. Optional params: filename (default: deck_{id}), max_attempts (default: 60), poll_interval (default: 5).
Reads an existing text file from the data directory. Returns the full text content so it can be updated without regenerating everything.
Creates or updates a plain text input file in the data directory. Returns whether file was created or updated. Used as input for Gamma deck generation.
Add entry to JSON file - all params except filename and entry_key become the entry data
Lists all entries in a JSON file. Warns if file has more than 50 entries and suggests using list_json_entries_chunked instead.
Reads entire JSON file and returns all entries. Use with caution on large files.

Search entries using field filters or keyword search. Required: filename. Optional field filters: pass any field name as parameter (e.g., status='todo', type='task', related_area='podcast'). Optional format: 'table' for markdown table, 'markdown' for bulleted list, 'summary' for statistics, omit for raw JSON (default). Use fields_to_return to limit response fields, max_results to cap results (default 50), case_insensitive for matching (default true). Server-side rendering speeds up display and reduces tokens.
Search entries in chunks for large result sets. Required: filename, search_value. Optional: chunk_size (default 20), chunk_index (default 0). Returns search_info with pagination details.
Updates entry fields. Required: filename, entry_key. All other params become update fields. Flat structure only.

Archives single email in Gmail (moves to archive folder, removes from INBOX) via Nylas API. folder_id defaults to Label_4287 (Unmistakable Archive). Usually called automatically by sync_archived_emails - rarely needs manual use.
Fetches inbox emails from Nylas, cleans body content for tagging only (body not stored in summary), auto-tags each message with Reply/Read/Update/Relax. Supports pagination.
Permanently deletes email from Gmail via Nylas API. Use with caution - this is irreversible. Archive is usually preferred over delete.

Generates pre-rendered intelligent email briefing (chunk size fixed at 10 emails). Returns executive summary + reply table with inline summaries + read items + relax overview. GPT renders the briefing with full context from email bodies. Navigate chunks by changing chunk_index (0 = first chunk, 1 = second, etc).
Fetches all inbox emails, auto-tags them, and writes to data/inbox_summary.json. Returns tag counts (Reply/Read/Update/Relax). Run this first to create the summary file.

Generates grouped summary of ALL Update-tagged emails. Groups by sender domain/service (e.g. GitHub: 3 updates, Stripe: 2 updates). Returns formatted markdown summary. Use when user asks to see all updates.
Returns ALL emails with specific tag (Reply/Read/Update/Relax). No chunking - returns full list. Use for filtering or when generating summaries of specific tag types.
Fetches full email body content from Nylas API for a specific message_id. Use when user needs to read full email content (not included in summary to keep file small).
Reads inbox_summary.json in chunks of 10 emails (default). Returns chunk data + chunk_info + summary_stats across ALL emails. Use this to paginate through inbox.

Replies to email with proper threading. Fetches original sender/subject, adds Re: prefix, sends reply via Nylas. Automatically tags original email as Replied + Archive and syncs to Gmail (email disappears from inbox). Use this instead of send_email when responding to existing emails.
Searches inbox_summary.json by sender email, subject keywords, or tag. At least one search parameter required. Returns matching emails with filter details.

Sends beautifully formatted email via Nylas. Script automatically handles HTML formatting and styling. Just provide recipient email, subject line, and plain text body. Optional: send_at (unix timestamp) to schedule email for later delivery. Use for brand new emails (not replies).

Scans inbox_summary.json for emails tagged with Archive, archives each in Gmail via Nylas API, removes archived emails from JSON file. Returns archived_count and remaining_count. Usually triggered automatically by tag_inbox_entry when Archive tag added.

Adds tags to email in inbox_summary.json. Tags can be string or list. If Archive tag added, automatically triggers sync_archived_emails (archives in Gmail + removes from JSON). Use for manual tagging or re-categorization.

Claude-powered consolidated inbox briefing. Reads all emails from inbox_summary.json, generates single comprehensive brief via Anthropic API. Preserves all existing tagging logic - just reads pre-tagged data. Outputs to data/daily_inbox_brief.json with executive summary, priority replies, notable items, updates breakdown, and recommended actions. Eliminates need for chunked briefing iteration.
Queries Outline's built-in AI feature for answers using your document corpus.

Creates a child document under a parent document with automatic collection detection from content tags (e.g., 'My content #Projects'). Requires parent_doc_id and supports same tag-based routing: #Projects, #Areas, #Resources, #Inbox, #Content, #Roles, #Maples. Defaults to Inbox if no tag specified.
Creates a new collection in Outline with name, icon, color, and sharing.

Creates a new document with automatic collection detection from content tags (e.g., 'My content #Projects'). Supports tag-based routing to collections: #Projects, #Areas, #Resources, #Inbox, #Content, #Roles, #Maples. Defaults to Inbox if no tag specified.
Archives a document in Outline instead of permanently deleting it. Archived documents can be restored later.
Exports a document from Outline to markdown format and saves locally.
Fetches document metadata and full content by document ID.
Fetches a document and its immediate child documents in Outline.
Returns the canonical Outline link to a doc by ID.
Uploads and imports a doc file (Markdown, etc.) into Outline. Accepts collection name (e.g. 'Resources', 'Inbox') which auto-resolves to ID.
Lists documents in a collection using pagination and sorting.
Moves a document to a new collection or parent document. Use hashtag like #Projects or collection name like Projects. Optional: parentDocumentId to nest document under a parent.
Queues a doc for import to Outline. Parses hashtags from file content (#collection #parent). Explicit params override hashtags. Collection required (param or hashtag).
Searches Outline documents by keyword and returns matches.
Updates a document's title or text. Provide either 'text' or 'file_path'. Can append or overwrite (default: overwrite).

Adds podcast episode entry with flat parameters. Required: entry_key, title, summary, midroll_time (mm:ss format). Optional: scheduled_publish_date (YYYY-MM-DD). Status auto-calculates: 'scheduled' if date provided, 'TBD' if not. Converts midroll_time to Acast marker format. Creates entry in podcast_index.json and triggers audio rename automation.

Preps a transcript and segments it for ad review based on timestamp blocks. Writes output to transcript_audit/. Expects 'guest_key' parameter (guest name/identifier, case-insensitive), resolves to actual transcript file via transcript_index.json.

Auto-creates batch from all unprocessed transcripts in transcript_index.json. Optional: batch_name (defaults to timestamp). Returns batch file with all transcripts marked as unprocessed. One command to queue all remaining work.
Creates a batch file containing a list of guest keys to process together. Validates transcript files exist and writes to batches/ directory. Expects 'batch_name' and 'guest_keys' (array) parameters.
Deletes a podcast episode entry from the central index by entry_key. Expects 'entry_key' parameter.

Extracts a midroll segment from a transcript based on static time window ([00:25:00] to [00:33:00]) and writes to midrolls/. Expects 'guest_key' parameter (guest name/identifier, case-insensitive), resolves to actual transcript file via transcript_index.json.
Retrieves a specific episode entry by key from the podcast index. Expects 'entry_key' parameter, returns complete episode metadata.

Parses raw transcript file, segments it into timestamped chunks by speaker, and outputs a formatted .md and .json index. Expects 'guest_key' parameter (guest name/identifier, case-insensitive), resolves to actual transcript file via transcript_index.json.

Complete workflow: runs prep_transcript, extract_midroll, auto-creates skeleton entry in podcast_index.json with blank title/summary/markers, and loads prep guidelines. Skeleton entry triggers audio rename automation immediately. Returns workflow protocol for completing the entry via update_episode_entry. Expects 'guest_key' parameter (guest name/identifier, case-insensitive).

Processes all transcripts in a batch file using process_episode_transcript logic. Creates skeleton entries for all transcripts in batch. Shows progress and saves detailed results. Expects 'batch_name' parameter, reads from batches/{batch_name}.batch.json.

Reads a previously extracted midroll segment file and returns raw markdown content. Expects 'entry_key' parameter (base name like 'jenifer-wallace'), auto-constructs path to midrolls/{entry_key}.midroll.md.

Updates episode metadata with flat parameters. Required: entry_key. Optional: any fields to update (title, summary, midroll_time, scheduled_publish_date, etc.). Converts midroll_time from mm:ss to Acast marker format automatically. Status auto-updates when scheduled_publish_date changes: 'scheduled' if real date provided, 'TBD' if date is 'TBD'. All fields except entry_key applied directly as updates.
Fetches all books from Readwise and stores the metadata to readwise_books.json for local caching.
Loads the cached book index and fetches all highlights for a specific book by title from Readwise.
Resets the thread state and loads OrchestrateOS runtime. Sets token budget and score baseline.
Core system manager — installs tools, sets credentials, builds working memory, and more.
Activates a thread intent lock to restrict tool access. Loads intent from registry and writes to thread_intent.json. Returns allowed tools and confirmation message.
Adds a specific action for a tool with script, params, and example payload.

Adds a new dashboard item. Required: key, source (file or tool_action), display_type, formatter. Optional: file (if source=file), tool/action/params (if source=tool_action), priority, limit, description, enabled.
Adds a path to memory_index.json for working memory construction.
Auto-added function: add_to_memory
Registers a new tool and script path into system_settings.ndjson.
Reads all indexed memory files and writes merged output to working_memory.json.
Auto-added function: clear_memory
Deactivates thread intent lock and returns to free_work mode. All tools become available again.
Returns current thread intent status including active flag, intent name, allowed tools, and violations count.
Auto-added function: get_working_memory
Registers a script as a tool and automatically adds all its valid functions as actions.
Returns all actions for a given tool, or all actions globally.
Lists all available intents from intent_registry.json with their allowed tools and descriptions.
Returns the full dashboard_index.json configuration including all items and config settings.
Lists all memory file paths tracked in memory_index.json.
Returns a list of all tools registered in system_settings.ndjson.
Adds a script to engine_registry.json for auto-start on boot.
Removes an action definition from a tool.
Removes a dashboard item by key from dashboard_index.json.
Removes a file path from memory_index.json if present.
Removes a tool and all its actions from the registry.
Bulk reorder dashboard items by priority. Pass array of objects with key and priority fields.
Parses script to detect required credential keys and injects them into credentials.json.
Enable or disable a dashboard item without deleting it. Pass enabled as true or false.

Updates custom_instructions.json with nested object merging. Pass updates in 'content' param using the existing nested structure (commands.CommandName.section.field). Merges new values into existing structure without overwriting unrelated fields.
Updates an existing dashboard item. Required: key. Optional: any field to update (source, file, tool, action, display_type, formatter, priority, limit, enabled, etc.).
Removes a function and dispatch router from script and system settings.

Inserts a new function above main(), registers it in system_settings.ndjson, and updates dispatch router. Required: file_path (path to script file), function_code (complete function definition as string with \n for newlines).
Replaces a function in a Python file using AST-based line detection.
Parse tasks from markdown document text. Extracts complete multi-line task descriptions including indented lines, code blocks, numbered lists, and doc links.
Centralized system performance analysis - execution stats, token metrics, system reports
Search Brave web API. Returns titles, URLs, descriptions. Optional: count (max 20), freshness (day/week/month).
Fetch content from URL. Format: text (default), html, markdown.
Search and auto-fetch content from top result. Criteria: top_result, official_docs, recent.

One-command task import from Outline doc. Fetches doc, parses tasks (# headers), generates deterministic task_ids, batch writes to queue. ~3 seconds for 10 tasks vs ~3 minutes with AI loop. Optional: test_mode (writes to claude_test_task_queue.json).

params.text: Here is my response to your question...

description: Reply to Claude Inbox. Hardcoded doc_id, always appends. Impossible to misuse - one param (text), one purpose.
Lists all scheduled emails that havent been sent yet. Returns schedule_id, subject, recipient, scheduled_for time, and status for each pending email.
Cancels a scheduled email by schedule_id. Email will not be sent. Use list_scheduled_emails to find schedule_ids.
